website_summaries.verdict: Combining the strength and precision of a diamond grit coated saw with the accuracy of the retractable pilot bit, this set makes perfection attainable.
pros: The luxury of having the AutoStart pilot bit with a spring-loaded, retractable shaft makes  starting cuts a breeze without the need for a pilot hole
Additionally, each saw is coated with a vacuum-brazed diamond grit for faster cuts and longer life
cons: Diamond wear rates were criticized by some, particularly when cutting materials like granite and marble

customer_reviews.title: Start on a 45 degree angle to prevent slipping.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Cut through our porcelain tile with ease. Here's how I did it: 1. Keep a cup of ice water next to you. 2. Insert the bit into the ice water to cool it off. 3. Begin drilling on high speed AT A 45 DEGREE ANGLE to start the hole. 4. Once the bit has started on an angle, tilt the bit slowly to level to cut the rest of the circle. 5. Every 5 seconds or so, DIP THE TIP into the ICE WATER, then go back at it with gentle pressure. Drilled six holes in less than 15 minutes PERFECTLY with NO SLIPPAGE to mount a handicap grab bar in the shower. YAY me. :)
customer_reviews.author: M. M.

customer_reviews.title: This bit requires a special center attachment or a 3/4" ...
customer_reviews.text: This bit requires a special center attachment or a 3/4" drill bit. No mention of this was made in the listing or on the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ward

customer_reviews.title: only brand that cuts stone tile
customer_reviews.text: We purchased another brand name hole saw sold at home improvement box stores and they would not work. We wasted hours trying to use a non Diamond hole saw. After reading articles online and how to videos on what best to use to cut stone tile the answer was clear a diamond hole saw. So please do not waste your time trying to use any other brand except Diamond. Again we wasted a whole weekend using non diamond. So in an effort to save you time and running around purchase a diamond hole saw. Remember to have someone hold the hose over the drill and tile to keep the hole saw and drill from getting too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent diamond drill bit
customer_reviews.text: Perfect diamond drill bit for drilling through porcelain tile to hang a shower door. Slow and easy with water cooling is the key to having the tool last. I had to drill 4 holes and each took about 5 minutes with a cordless drill and a water spray bottle. A drill guide is also recommended; especially for vertical surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Marble Countertop
customer_reviews.text: I used this to drill two holes in my marble countertop for soap dispensers. The depth was about 3/4 inch. The cut, as you can see, is very clean and even. The process of making the cut was quite easy with a wooden template I taped to the top surface. Took about 5 minutes to penetrate and the bit did not get hot. I used some ice water for cooling during the cut. After two holes it still felt like it has a lot more life left in it.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvan C.

customer_reviews.title: well thought out design
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed by the whole saw set. I used one of the smaller bits to cut 18 holes in a tiled shower walls to install grab bars. There was no sign of wear on the bit. I used the largest how saw to cut around a shower valve in a tiled wall with no problem. I liked the quick connect feature and the centering bit. I used some one to drill the hole and another person to spray the area with water. You need to drill slow, use light pressure and spray with water. I would highly recommend this set.
customer_reviews.author: my painted lady

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: I used the 1/2 inch bit to drill holes for a toilet flange into marble mosaic tile. The marble pieces were somewhat fragile and I was worried that a cheap carbide bit would destroy them. You have to know to start the bit at a 45 degree angle and dip it in water every five seconds or so. That may sound onerous, but it's not when it comes to tile. It only took about 4 dips to make one hole in 3/8 inch marble. And the timing is easy to figure - just dip it when the dust starts to look a little dry. You want it to look like a slurry at all times.
customer_reviews.author: archeopteryx

customer_reviews.title: Drills through ceramic tile.
customer_reviews.text: Needed this to drill through ceramic tile to install the intake/outlet for a Toyo stove. Took forever (seems like it was an hour), but did not crack or break the tile that was already installed (whew!). It doesn't come with a pilot bit that would probably walk all over the slick tile surface anyway. I built a jig to hold the drill in place and it worked very well. Tried to attach photo of the jig.
customer_reviews.author: frozebubba

customer_reviews.title: Solid Bit for granite.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to drill a 1/2 inch hole in my granite for a faucet for under-counter reverse osmosis water system. Did the job well. Drilled through 1 inch thick granite in only a few minutes with this bit and a dewalt drill. The bit jumps around a little at first until you can get a groove cut. I was recommended to cut a hole in a piece of wood and tape it to the sink to keep this from happening. If I had to use these bits again I would recommend this technique.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Bouley

customer_reviews.title: Great hole saw for lath and plaster
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic hole saw for lath and plaster ceiling work.I can get 1 to 1 1/2 holes drilled with a standard or bimetal (milwaukee or Diablo brands from the box store) bit, but after 6 holes this cuts just as clean and fast as the first hole. I just wish they had it in more incremental sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably good value
customer_reviews.text: The Bosch bit was okay for the price. I used it to drill four holes through concrete (with a water dribble), and although it was slow it got the job done. I could see visible wear on the teeth, so I figure I've used about half its life. My only quibble with these is the arbor with the center starter. You can't drill the hole very deep without hitting the center starter, so I had to drill a pilot hole through the concrete a little larger than the center starter, which was a lot of extra work. It would be better if the center starter was retractable the full depth of the hole saw.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dollar! Great for plaster.
customer_reviews.text: I used this holesaw to cut holes in my 1” thick plaster ceiling for recessed lighting! After cutting the 4holes the holesaw still looks brand new. I previously used a steel Milwaukee holesaw on my plaster ceiling and it seriously lasted only 20seconds and didn’t even cut one hole. Waste of $20. If cutting threw plaster ‘BUY’ this holesaw and stay away from a regular steel toothed holesaw.
customer_reviews.author: naaman

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to keep an old 1956 wall mount with chrome legs. The legs have a nub that needs to be set into the tile. I used plummer’s putty to make a well & filled it with water to keep it cool. Used some scrap tile to practice on before I did the real holes. Gotta go slow to get it started and keep with that 45 degree angle until you’ve made a nice cut, then even it out for the rest of the cut. Worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: S & T Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the $, a time saver.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast and works really well drilling through porcelain tile. It took me about 30 seconds to drill through 1/4” tile. The photo was taken after 20 hole in porcelain tile. The diamond bits on the head are still intact! I make sure to dip the bit in water after every 5-10 seconds to prevent overheating. Much better then those cheap chrome ones you see a lot of.
customer_reviews.author: kvrntr

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: I had to core a 2-1/4" hold through a brick wall. No place locally had a 2-1/4" hole saw suitable for the task, so I ordered this one. It worked wonderfully. It cut a nice, clean hole through the brick. Due to space constraints I could not use water for cooling or lubrication, but found neither to be necessary. The hole saw never seemed to get hot, and I would remove it and clean out the swarf after every 1/4" or so. It took a bit of time, as the hole I had to core was actually deeper than the bit, but by breaking out the cut pieces as I went it was not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Quality Bit
customer_reviews.text: Cut a beautiful hole in counter top for filtered water faucet in about three minutes. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: mad scientist

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Used it to install faucet for filtered water. First time that I drilled a whole in granite. Was nervous as I did not want to destroy my kitchen counter. Watched YouTube instruction on how to drill into polished granite (highly recommended). Drill bit performed excellently and within minutes I had a perfectly drilled hole for a fraction of what it had cost if I had done it by a professional.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended, and then some
customer_reviews.text: I used this to drill a 6 inch deep hole in concrete. Due to the depth of the hole, much deeper than the bit, off and on I had to chisel out the center portion. The bit still looks great, as if it could drill many more such holes. The teeth have no apparent wear and the hole had very smooth consistent sides. I added water as I drilled and this probably helped
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Hands down, best diamond bit I've used.
customer_reviews.text: This thing puts other diamond bits to shame. I had to drill through porcelain tile in a shower to hang the curtain rod. First, I used a cheap set and it took forever to drill one hole. Then, on the second hole it wore out. So I ordered this one. It's arbored, so it popped right into my impact driver, and I had two holes cut through the tile in under a minute each. Best part is, the bit looks brand new. I bet this thing will last for a while. Well worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: If you want to do it right the first time
customer_reviews.text: This is the right tool for the job. Let me begin by stating that you cannot use this cutter without the Bosch PCM38AN 3 PC Universal Quick Change Mandrel Kit. You need the mandrel in order to attach the cutter to the drill motor. While you do your best to have holes fall nearer the center of tiles, we all know that's not always possible and I ending up having one tile with two holes close to the edge. That being said, this hole saw was concentric enough to cut holes within 1/8" of the edge of the tile and not break it. I was very impressed and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave V.

customer_reviews.title: Best option to drill into hard porcelain tile, worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Recently used it and the results were great. Clean holes without creating hairline and "spider web" cracks. Tips when using and to extend life of bit. Position at 45 degree angle and when bit bites the tile , slowly up the bit to 90 degrees. Never drill at high speed and intermittently cool bit with water.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to cut some holes for electrical pass-throughs. Didn't notice it in the moment, but this cut right through a #5 rebar. Now, I'm sure this isn't advised use, but it's nice to know that when push comes to shove this hole saw can cut through hidden rebar in masonry if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specific drill to drill a small hole in my granite to add a r o faucet to our sink. The granite was quite thick so if you have fairly thick Granite I would probably choose a longer drill bit. Otherwise it cut the hole smoothly and worked very well. Be sure to cool the bit with ice water while drilling.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Worked well in cutting through a quartz countertop
customer_reviews.text: Needed to install an Instant Hot water heater under my sink that didn't have an existing hole. This is a quartz counter top and this saw made short work of it. Nice clean hole. Bought this with the Bosch Quick Change Mandrel and the combo works perfectly. Definitely recommend for cutting through hard counter surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: DrFranco

customer_reviews.title: Drills multiple holes in granite
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the other bits I tried, that did not even drill 1 hole, the Bosch 1" bit drilled 4 holes in a granite counter top that looks to really be granite composed of quartz, feldspar, and biotite. Three of the holes took between 5 and 15 minutes each but the third hole took 30 minutes, my guess is there was a lot of quartz in that area. After the third hole took so long I thought the bit was shot but it was the 4th hole that took only 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Spike Turbinado

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: I used this to drill a hole in a porcelain enameled sink and it worked perfectly. Just keep your drill site wet and don’t use too high an RPM and you will be all set. It took a while to drill through, maybe 10-15 minutes but that is to be expected with the thickness of the sink which was around 1/4” thick.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M. Riley

customer_reviews.title: I am a contractor in Florida, I do commercial work.
customer_reviews.text: I am a contractor in Florida, I do commercial work. That’s important to know when I’m hanging grab bars and going through tile whether it be ceramic or porcelain these work great strongly recommend. You can drill up to 30 holes with this bit.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $
customer_reviews.text: This little bit was spendy but I spent the same for a crappy carbide tip at the local little hardware store. The previous one burnt out before one hole was drilled. This one made short work finishing the first hole and zipping through the second one.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to drill a hole in our granite counter top to install a faucet for our filtered water system. Worked very well did not have any issues. Bit held up and got the job done pretty fast. Bought it for a one time use but will update on quality if i ever need to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cut a hole in a composite sink and it worked flawlessly!!! I shopped around at other retailers but this bit was much cheaper and probably worked just as well as the others. A great buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: DeeVine DeeZine

customer_reviews.title: drill porcelain like a butter
customer_reviews.text: Get this bit to hook up shower column over porcelain tiles. I kill 2 diamond discs by cutting this tile and was very concern about drill bit performance. I made 8 hols in no time! I didn't notice any drilling speed difference between first and last hols.
customer_reviews.author: Serg Pososhenko

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, tough enough
customer_reviews.text: Used it to grind out a broken tap in the head of an old bulldozer engine. We used Windex as the lube/coolant. Slow going but worked. We used two cheaper diamond hole saws first and finished with this one when we got close to the bottom of the tap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to get your center point, but it definitely makes short work of the hole and lasts. I drilled out 14 holes for a shower door install, all through tile and marble, and it never lost its edge. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Empty

customer_reviews.title: Read the Instructions and a Take Your Time
customer_reviews.text: Followed the instructions for using this specialized drill bit and was able to drill 6 holes in the hard tile in our shower, so a safety bar could be installed. It takes a little patience - not like drilling through a piece of pine lumber.
customer_reviews.author: Eye Pod

customer_reviews.title: Great tool. Drilled all 8 holes I needed in my porcelain tile..
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. I needed 8 holes in my porcelain tile. This diamond bit did the trick. I tried another carbide tip bit first and it took hours to drill through. I could drill a hole in 5-10 minutes with this. I dipped the end in water every couple minutes to keep it cool. After 8 holes, I can start to see some wear, but it did the job for me and I'm sure I could do drill more holes with it if I needed them.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle & Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with my purchase, this bit cuts through porcelain tile like butter. Cant say how long it will last since I only needed to drill two holes, but it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Adelman

customer_reviews.title: Did the job quickly on porcelain tile
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Needed to install glass shower doors. Tried a 5/16 masonry bit. Barely left a mark on porcelain tile after 10 min of drilling. Ordered this bit and drilled four holes in less than 15 min. Buy genuine Bosch, you won’t regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, I wonder if buying cheaper models in volume would be better
customer_reviews.text: 3 holes and this thing was fairly scrapped. It cuts slowly, even fresh out of the box However, it outlasts the other, cheaper alternatives. The others cut faster, but run out after one hole. It's a tough balancing act....
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hanley

customer_reviews.title: Drills a nice hole in ceramic tile
customer_reviews.text: Drills a nice hole in ceramic tile. Holds its place well without the drifting you get from a carbide tip drill bit. If you have to drill one of these holes I sympathize and highly recommend this tool to make the job a little less stressful.
customer_reviews.author: JDS

customer_reviews.title: Cut through porcelain like butter!
customer_reviews.text: This thing hogged through porcelain tile no problem! Keep it wet so you dont burn the teeth off. Even my plumber was impressed and he uses bits like this every day
customer_reviews.author: Lchbuilders

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says on Porcelain
customer_reviews.text: Like the other reviews state...use water go in at an angle and no issues at all! My porcelain, like other reviews, is smooth so slipped a little. I found if I just slowly ran the drill to scuff the area it helped. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through stone like butter!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cut a large 4 1/8" hole through our hearth for an air ventilation duct to comply with new wood stove code ventilation requirements. Per instructions, we ran it at low RPM and applied water while cutting with a weed sprayer. Made a nice smooth hole with minimal effort. My only minor compliant- You will also need the proprietary universal Bosch driver for this hole saw as it is not compatible with other name brands. However, it worked very well for its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: NW_OR_USA

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This drill bit works great. It helps to create a dam out of backer board or wood to guid the bit for the start of the cut. Also, water will make the bit last longer. Loved the tool.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: worked for us
customer_reviews.text: We were in the middle of a project and needed to drill 2 3.75" holes in marble. NONE of our local stores stocked this size. None. We live in a suburb of Detroit. Seriously! Best they could do was get it to us in 2 weeks or we could try to work something out with a 3" hole. Ordered this, had it the next day thanks to amazon's shipping options. We drilled the 2 holes without a problem! The bit didn't seem to dull at all. Granted it was only 2 holes but I've used bits for other machines that dull almost immediately. Our contractor was so impressed he bought one himself.
customer_reviews.author: Detroit Chick

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on granite.
customer_reviews.text: I used it for granite, with the use of some water to cool it down it did a great job on high speed drill, light pressure. Worked as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus is Lord!

customer_reviews.title: worked with no problems, and received it when I ...
customer_reviews.text: worked with no problems, and received it when I was supposed to while the need was there, I ordered it when I received a message that the first and second orders (different brand) would not arrive in time to do my job
customer_reviews.author: J. West

customer_reviews.title: Bit seems to be good for about a dozen holes then begins to lose ...
customer_reviews.text: Used the bit to drill holes to mount a shower door over porcelain tile. It works. Keep spraying it with water as you drill. It's a slow process. Bit seems to be good for about a dozen holes then begins to lose it's edge.
customer_reviews.author: Jim  N.

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: i had to drill some holes in brand new porcelain shower tiles to mount a grab bar. every one on the internet was talking about how hard and scary it would be. all fools, this thing made short and easy work of it
customer_reviews.author: Ivan A Millich II

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recomended!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to drill the hole in my ceramic tile for the water control. Worked very well when combined with the center point available separately. As long as you go slow, the diamonds will last through lots of holes no problem. In my case I set the drill to the low gear and went about half speed. Just need to be patient and use lots of cool water. The center point works well on the smaller hole saws but for this one I found that I needed a small dimple provided by a Bosch carbide tile bit to help keep everything centered and get the hole started.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Terwillager

customer_reviews.title: Great drill bit.  Eats through rock
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bit to drill through rock to make climbing holds. It does a great job. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: NYC reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent. Great quality tool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hole saw to drill a hole in my enameled cast iron sink. I wanted to install a water filtering system. This was the right tool for the job. It made a clean hole and didn't damage the sink. Of course you will find some cheaper diamond saw, but my experirence is that they would not have worked... They wear too quickly. This one did cut through the thick sink and still look new. Buy good quality diamond saw and you will be amazed how they can make an impossible job look easy.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: Cut glass like a champ.
customer_reviews.text: I used this hole saw to cut wire routing holes in glass shelves to accommodate robe lighting. I had to keep the holes quite close to the edge of glass shelves (within 1/4" at a corner) and I was fully expecting the glass to break due to the pressure I would need to cut through. I was pleasantly surprised to find that this sawed through the glass with light enough pressure to keep the corner intact with no fracturing. I used it to cut 7 holes and the bit worked as well on the last cut as the first.
customer_reviews.author: ScruddlyJr

customer_reviews.title: Drills holes
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to drill plastic so it does not have to be durable. It drills a clean round hole, ok.
customer_reviews.author: boB

customer_reviews.title: Works as good as the description claims!
customer_reviews.text: Needed these quickly for a job I'm doing, Amazon's one day shipping was on time as usual. I was struggling cutting holes through an incredibly hard tile floor, all my cutters failed miserably! I used these today for the first time and they worked great! It's really important to take your time and use water to keep the saw cool. The starter bit and the quick disconnect set up are a big perk with this kit. If you follow the instructions you will have no problems. This is a great price for the amount of cutters you are getting! I trusted the Bosch name and it paid off!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth H.

customer_reviews.title: WON'T CUT CERAMIC TILE OR STUCCO/CONCRETE
customer_reviews.text: REALLY FRUSTRATING AND EXPENSIVE. A CARBIDE BIT WORKS MUCH BETTER FOR CONCRETE, STONE AND CERAMIC TILE.
customer_reviews.author: buck stops here

customer_reviews.title: Cut counter-top like butter!
customer_reviews.text: It works great, cut though a counter-top for a drinking water faucet, spraying some water on it and didn't experience any overheating. Very easy process.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: used water to cool the drill site
customer_reviews.text: I used this to install a Reverse Osmosis system. Works as anticipated and I did not ruin my granite. :) I took my time, used water to cool the drill site, and angled the bit to start.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Saws
customer_reviews.text: Seem like high quality saws. Pilot bit could be stronger.
customer_reviews.author: David Shepardson

customer_reviews.title: Did the job perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Easily connects to the mandrel. Used it with a cordless drill. Perfect holes in marble and ceramic tiles.
customer_reviews.author: G.M

customer_reviews.title: Great saw bit for the DIY'er
customer_reviews.text: I had to expand a hole in our 1 1/2" for a hot water dispenser. Instead of paying someone $75 to come out and drill a hole, I decided to do it myself. My only suggestion is to follow directions on keeping the bit wet and cool. It makes quick work of the job. This is a job that any DIY'er can do themselves if they read the directions and take their time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I broke an easy-out of in a stuck bolt. This made quick work of cutting through the hardened steel easy-out.
customer_reviews.author: Sexy Eyeball

customer_reviews.title: Top shelf.
customer_reviews.text: I used this with my bosch hammer drill on the drill setting. I used a water hose to trickle water into the saw. The cutting was smooth ant effortless. The Finnish extreamly smooth. Started the hole with the center bit. Well worth it 👌
customer_reviews.author: carl

customer_reviews.title: Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I guess I drilled about 30-40 porcelain plates with these before it dulled. Worked well but would've like to get a little better wear
customer_reviews.author: Stanz358

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Got this to drill holes in bottles so that I could install lights. Worked great!
customer_reviews.author: ncfyrfyter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bit to make hole for RO faucet or soap dispenser
customer_reviews.text: It went through the granite 1-inch counter top like butter with an impact drill. Had no issues with it. As other mentioned wet the surface, cut the surface in an angle then straight down once the bit has something to latch on, use water to ease the process, a little patience and presto the hole I needed for my RO faucet was made. Hope to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Eugenious

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm. Follow the instructions
customer_reviews.text: Got it to install the RO water system. Drilled a hole on the Granite (1 1/2" Thick). Follow the instruction on the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Biju

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Need to make sure you purchase the "Bosch HDGQA 3/8 In. AutoStart Carbide Hole Saw Quick Change Mandrel" as you will need this to get it to work with the quick change feature on whole saw. Wasn't excited about having to buy another component but they both worked extremely well. Used this to create a sink drain hole in 1-1/4" thick granite.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Reinhardt

customer_reviews.title: Made cutting easy
customer_reviews.text: Used this to cut a hole in Quartz counter top to mount an RO faucet. Was my first time cutting a hole in quartz, but this bit cut throw with ease. Go slow and use plenty of water, and you will have a perfect hole.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Worked great in concrete stucco.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for several holes in 1 inch hard concrete stucco. Worked great. No apparent wear yet. Made in Taiwan. Not China.
customer_reviews.author: CG in Colo

customer_reviews.title: Quality drill bit for porcelain tile.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to drill holes in porcelain bath tile for a shower door. Worked great. 7 holes, no problem with the angled start technique plus water.
customer_reviews.author: Just cruisin

customer_reviews.title: Well made and durable.
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit dubious of the quality from big names, because of the power of the beancounter, but this bit has delivered and looks like it will continue.
customer_reviews.author: Art my middle name

customer_reviews.title: Surprising
customer_reviews.text: This hole saw worked much better than I had anticipated! I used it to drill hole in a rock column to install four inch boxes for light fixtures and it worked perfectly without water even! Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.author: Tim I

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on porcelain tiles
customer_reviews.text: Use in a cordless drill and don’t drill on high speed. Dip in water to keep cool and press firmly but not hard.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Quick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent diamond bit
customer_reviews.text: I used this bit to install a grab bar in my ceramic tile shower. The bits worked great. Just use plenty of water and start on a 45 degree angle.
customer_reviews.author: rickmont

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for drilling through my silestone counter top
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for drilling through my silestone counter top. I drilled for about 10 seconds and then ran water over the bit to cool it off and then repeated this process about 10 times until it went all the way through.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence Nixa

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Used this to drill through porcelain tile. The first hole was slow and the second hole was slower, but it did the job. It would not do a third hole!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for drilling thru tile
customer_reviews.text: We were able to drill thru porcelain tile so we could hang shower doors
customer_reviews.author: JSD

customer_reviews.title: Good quality bit
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for drilling a hole in a 1" granite countertop. The bit showed almost no wear after use.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Have drilled 22 holes in porcelain tile so far and it's still going strong. Run it slow and spray cooling water on it and it seems like it will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: cuts, but moves
customer_reviews.text: like...drilled through porcelain tile...eventually no cracking dislike...hard to find center, then keep on center. maybe theres tricks out there, wish I'd known what those are.
customer_reviews.author: RPut

customer_reviews.title: Use wet with tile!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to drill through porcelain tile to hang shelves. I went through one bit right away, than started using a new one wet and this bit drilled about ten holes with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cuts great! Easy to use. Make sure you have the autostart quick change mandrel
customer_reviews.author: kevin duby

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I used it to drill two holes on my bathroom tile wall, it worked well, each hole took me about 15 min or so, I constantly cool it down, which used more time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw after doing some research on how to drill through ceramic tile. I had many carbide saws that I'd used in the past but drilling through tile was a totally different application. I had a lot of apprehension after reading all the warnings about drilling through tile but this saw made short work of it. Just follow the instructions and keep the saw moist and it zips right on through without cracks or breakage.
customer_reviews.author: keaise

customer_reviews.title: Made quick work of quartz
customer_reviews.text: Cut through quarts countertop to make an easy install of new RO system faucet. Worked great with 12V Bosch drill.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Plant pot drain driller
customer_reviews.text: Worked well to drill drainage holes in ceramic coated plant pots.
customer_reviews.author: KAREN VINSON

customer_reviews.title: But once cry once
customer_reviews.text: Works well! We got this to drill holes through plaster and lath for new LED lights. Works very good on plaster. Clean fast holes.
customer_reviews.author: Jamen wolf

customer_reviews.title: Item came damaged/bent
customer_reviews.text: Item came bent, unable to use. By bent I mean in oval shape, item came damaged.
customer_reviews.author: charlie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and cutting was a breeze
customer_reviews.text: You can actually use this with a hand held drill because of the centering bit. Good quality and cutting was a breeze. Just make sure you puddle up the water or turn the hose on slowly and let it run over the tile/marble to keep the cutter cool.
customer_reviews.author: Grendal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for porcelain.
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well. Drilled four holes in very hard porcelain tile and the bit looks ready for more. You have to start at a very extreme angle to start the bit and the bring it up to perpendicular. Use a piece of tape to locate your hole before starting. Keeping that in mind it works really well. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: inCS

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Made a cut for an outlet in a quartz top, and wow, this thing went though it like butter. I did use some water during cutting,but very impressive and it did not seem to dull the blade at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: These things are amazing compared to the bits I was using to drill through glass before. Keep water on the area being cut and these bits will last a good bit of time before needing to be replaced. I use mine in a drill press so I can't comment on the ease of use in a hand drill but I can't imagine it would be complicated. These cut clean and cut fast.
customer_reviews.author: AKF

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money for this paper weight/paper clip holder.
customer_reviews.text: Five stars for durability because won’t be able to use it. I can not find right size mandrel. Mandrel hard to find
customer_reviews.author: S Camacho

customer_reviews.title: ... did require quite a bit of water to keep cool, slow progress but steady
customer_reviews.text: Works very well did require quite a bit of water to keep cool, slow progress but steady.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Im Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Item works very well. I was impressed with the speed in which it cuts through glass wine bottles. I used modeling clay to build a circular dike around the intended location of the hole, filled it with water to keep the bit cool. I would periodically lift the bit to allow fresh water to flow to the inside of the bit. I am using a drill press but imagine it would me a little more difficult if holding freehand
customer_reviews.author: Shadow

customer_reviews.title: It’s a drill bit
customer_reviews.text: Drilled through ceramic tile and quartz counters with no problems once you get it started
customer_reviews.author: M. M. M.

customer_reviews.title: this is perfect for putting through 4" pipe/ducting of any type
customer_reviews.text: IF you don't want to go to the expensive of buying a coring rig and are working in softer/older materials (old brick for instance), this is perfect for putting through 4" pipe/ducting of any type.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, clean holes in Carrara marble
customer_reviews.text: Used this to drill (3) 3” holes in 18”x18” Carrara marble. Mounted this in my drill press, and had my son mist with water while cutting. The result was three clean, perfect holes with no chipping. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: mmassaro

customer_reviews.title: Reliably makes holes in 1/4 inch glass
customer_reviews.text: Reliably makes holes in 1/4 inch glass over 50 holes and still cutting
customer_reviews.author: Dave G.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Cuts like a dream. I have only used this on cinder block so I can’t speak for its performance otherwise, but given how it handled a block wall I’m inclined to believe it would work quite well with harder materials.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Veator

product_meta.title: Bosch HDG11 11-Piece Diamond Hole Saw Set
product_meta.description:
Size:11 Piece Set| Style:SetFast and easy starts, even in the hardest materials like porcelain and granite. Quick Change universal hole saw system allows change to any size or type of hole saw in seconds. For use only with machines designed for wet sawing and on a GFCI-protected circuit.

AMAZON.COM
The Bosch diamond grit hole saw is one of the latest additions to the Bosch hole saw product line. The hole saw features vacuum brazing technology for faster cutting and longer life than competitive products. As with Bosch's entire line of hole saws, these products are part of the patented Quick Change universal hole saw system, which lets you change hole saws in seconds. Bosch's new diamond grit hole saws start fast and simple, every time.
feature_bullets: Vacuum-brazed diamond grit cuts faster and lasts longer
Segmented teeth reduce debris and heat
AutoStart pilot bit is spring-loaded, retractable shaft allows walk-free cutting without a pilot hole
Pilot bit offers unique grind that starts holes accurately every time
Set includes: (1) mandrel, (1) AutoStart pilot bit, hole saws: (1) 1/4 inch, (1) 5/16 inch, (1) 3/8 inch, (1) 5/8 inch, (1) 1 inch, (1) 1-3/8 inch, (1) 2 inch, (1) 2-1/4 inch, (1) 2-1/2 inch
